[[Image:Fragment of old Chile Millionaire.jpg|thumb|Opening from Sergio Lagos era of show]]
 
[[File:The only winner in Chile QQSM.jpg|thumb|Gonzalo Miranda, a 29-year old history teacher is the only person to win CLP$100,000,000]]
[[File:The only winner in Chile QQSM.jpg|thumb|Gonzalo Miranda, a 29-year old history teacher is the only person to win CLP$100,000,000]]
'''''Â¿QuiÃ©n quiere ser millonario?''''' ([[English language|English]] [[translation]]: ''Who wants to be a millionaire?'') was a [[Chile]]an [[game show]] based on the original [[British language|British]] format of ''[[Who Wants to Be a Millionaire?]]''. The [[game show|show]] was hosted by Sergio Lagos (earlier by [[Don Francisco]]). The main goal of the [[game]] was to win [[CLP$]]65 million (earlier [[CLP$]]100 million) by answering 15 [[multiple-choice]] [[question]]s correctly. There were three ''lifelines'' - fifty fifty, phone a friend and ask the audience. ''Â¿QuiÃ©n quiere ser millonario?'' was broadcast from [[2001]] to [[2004]]. It was shown on the [[TV station]] [[Canal 13 (Chile)|Canal 13]]. When a [[contestant]] got the fifth question correct, he left with at least [[CLP$]]250,000 (earlier [[CLP$]]250,000). When a contestant got the tenth question correct, he left with at least [[CLP$]]2,000,000 (earlier [[CLP$]]3,200,000. <u>Now, the show is called ''[[Â¿QuiÃ©n merece ser millonario?]]''.</u>
'''''Â¿QuiÃ©n quiere ser millonario?''''' ([[English language|English]] [[translation]]: ''Who wants to be a millionaire?'') was a [[Chile]]an [[game show]] based on the original [[British language|British]] format of ''[[Who Wants to Be a Millionaire?]]''. The [[game show|show]] was hosted by Sergio Lagos (earlier by [[Don Francisco]]). The main goal of the [[game]] was to win [[CLP$]]65 million (earlier [[CLP$]]100 million) by answering 15 [[multiple-choice]] [[question]]s correctly. There were three ''lifelines'' - fifty fifty, phone a friend and ask the audience. ''Â¿QuiÃ©n quiere ser millonario?'' was broadcast from [[2001]] to [[2004]]. It was shown on the [[TV station]] [[Canal 13 (Chile)|Canal 13]]. When a [[contestant]] got the fifth question correct, he left with at least [[CLP$]]250,000 (earlier [[CLP$]]250,000). When a contestant got the tenth question correct, he left with at least [[CLP$]]2,000,000 (earlier [[CLP$]]3,200,000. <u>Now, the show is called ''[[Â¿QuiÃ©n merece ser millonario?]]''.</u>
